page.title: 20Victorian Assembly,Barton
page.content: The Thomas Russell Junior School held a Victorian school assembly as part of the centenary celebrations of the Thomas Russell School (now the Infant School).It was so different to the normal school assemblies because the teachers were very strict and always had stern tone in their voices.The teachers all had mats by their chairs and we soon found out what they were for.Instead of having a story we had read to us a very long prayer during which we had to kneel on the hard floor with our backs straight.The teachers of course had mats on which to kneel.After assembly we had a handkerchief inspection.Surprisingly most children did not have one!We all had to answer teachers using the word "Sir" or "Ma'am".
